name: Patient seeks protection
text: Administer to persons seeking protection.

name: Undergoing elective splenectomy
text: Administer to persons who are undergoing elective splenectomy if they have not previously received the vaccine.

name: Immunocompromised
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient is immunocompromised.

name: Recipient of a hematopoietic stem cell transplant
text: Administer to recipients of a hematopoietic stem cell transplant [HSCT] 6 to 12 months after a successful transplant, regardless of vaccination history.

name: Hepatitis C virus infection
text: Administer to persons with a hepatitis C virus infection.

name: Receives clotting factor concentrates
text: Administer to persons who receive clotting factor concentrates.

name: Pregnant
text: Administer to women who are pregnant. Do not vaccinate if the patient is pregnant.

name: Travel to an area of active cholera transmission
text: Administer to adult travelers (aged 18-64 years) from the United States traveling to an area of active cholera transmission.

name: Breastfeeding
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient is breastfeeding.

name: Cerebrospinal fluid leaks
text: Administer to persons who have cerebrospinal fluid leaks.

name: Cochlear implants
text: Administer to persons who have cochlear implants.

name: Family history of altered immunocompetence
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has a family history of altered immunocompetence

name: Severe Combined Immunodeficiency [SCID]
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has Severe Combined Immunodeficiency [SCID].

name: Diabetes
text: Administer to persons who have diabetes.

name: Chronic liver disease
text: Administer to persons who have chronic liver disease.

name: Chronic heart disease
text: Administer to persons who have chronic heart disease.

name: Chronic lung disease
text: Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease.

name: Laboratory Evidence of Immunity or confirmation of Hepatitis A disease
Laboratory Evidence of Immunity or confirmation of Hepatitis B disease
Laboratory Evidence of Immunity for Measles
Laboratory Evidence of Immunity for Mumps
Laboratory Evidence of Immunity for Rubella
Laboratory Evidence of Immunity or confirmation of Varicella disease
Healthcare provider verified history of or diagnosis of Varicella
Healthcare provider verified history or diagnosis of Herpes Zoster
Persons with perinatal HIV infection who do not have evidence of severe immunosuppression and who were vaccinated with MMR before establishment of antiviral therapy [ART]
text: Administer to persons with perinatal HIV infection who do not have evidence of severe immunosuppression and who were vaccinated with MMR before establishment of antiviral therapy [ART].

name: Asthma
text: Administer to persons who have asthma. Do not vaccinate if the patient has asthma.

name: Intussusception
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has intussusception.

name: Acute gastroenteritis
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has acute gastroenteritis.

name: Acute febrile illness
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has acute febrile illness.

name: Tuberculosis
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has active untreated tuberculosis.

name: Dialysis patient
text: Administer to hemodialysis patients and predialysis, peritoneal dialysis, and home dialysis patients

name: Taken influenza antiviral medications within the previous 48 hours
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has taken influenza antiviral medications  within the previous 48 hours.

name: Receiving long-term aspirin therapy
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient is receiving long-term aspirin therapy.

name: Antimicrobial or antimalarial taken within 72 hours
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient  has taken antimicrobial or antimalarial medications  within the previous 72 hours.

name: Men who have sex with men
text: Administer to men who have sex with men.

name: Not in a long-term, mutually monogamous relationship
text: Administer to persons not in a long-term, mutually monogamous relationship.

name: Sex partner of Hepatitis B surface antigen-positive persons
text: Administer to persons who are a sex partner of a Hepatitis B surface antigen-positive person.

name: Receives treatment for STD
text: Administer to persons who receive treatment for STD.

name: Illicit drug use
text: Administer to persons who use illicit drugs.

name: Illicit injection drug use
text: Administer to persons who use illicit injection drugs.

name: Smoke cigarettes
text: Administer to persons who smoke cigarettes.

name: Alcoholism
text: Administer to persons who have alcoholism.

name: Close contact with international adoptee during first 60 days
text: Administer to persons who will have close contact with an international adoptee during the first 60 days.

name: Travel to country with a Yellow Fever vaccination entry requirement
text: Administer to persons who travel to a country with a Yellow Fever vaccination entry requirement.

name: College students living in residence halls
text: Administer to college students living in residence halls.

name: Resident of area at risk for exposure to the disease
text: Administer to residents of an area at risk for exposure to the disease.

name: Travelling Internationally
text: Administer to persons who will be travelling internationally.

name: Working with Hepatitis A virus in research setting
text: Administer to persons who work with Hepatitis A virus in a research setting.

name: Microbiologists routinely exposed to Neisseria meningitidis
text: Administer to microbiologists routinely exposed to isolates of Neisseria meningitidis.

name: Microbiology laboratorians who work frequently with S. typhi
text: Administer to persons who are microbiology laboratorians who work frequently with S. typhi.

name: Laboratory personnel who might be exposed to YFV
text: Administer to laboratory personnel who might be exposed to virulent YFV or to concentrated preparations of YF vaccine virus strains by direct or indirect contact or by aerosols.

name: Rabies researchers
text: Administer to Rabies researchers.

name: Laboratory workers who handle specimens that might contain polioviruses
text: Administer to laboratory workers who handle specimens that might contain polioviruses.

name: Health care personnel
text: Administer to healthcare personnel without evidence of immunity.

name: Health-care workers who have close contact with patients who might be excreting wild polioviruses
text: Administer to health-care workers who have close contact with patients who might be excreting wild polioviruses.

name: Public safety worker exposed to blood or infection body fluids
text: Administer to public safety workers exposed to blood or infection body fluids

name: Staff of institution for persons with developmental disabilities
text: Administer to staff of institution for persons with developmental disabilities

name: Occupational exposure for Hepatitis A
text: Administer to persons who have an occupational exposure for Hepatitis A

name: Veterinarians and their staff
text: Administer to veterinarians and their staff.

name: Animal handlers
text: Administer to animal handlers.

name: Persons whose activities bring them into frequent contact with rabies virus or potentially rabid animals
text: Administer to persons whose activities bring them into frequent contact with rabies virus or potentially rabid animals.

name: Post secondary student
text: Administer to persons who are students in a postsecondary educational institution.

name: Military recruits
text: Administer to military recruits.

name: Client of institution for persons with developmental disabilities
text: Administer to persons who are a client of institution for persons with developmental disabilities.

name: Chronic renal failure
text: Administer to persons with chronic renal failure. Do not vaccinate if the patient has chronic renal failure.

name: In drug abuse treatment and prevention facility
text: Administer to persons who are in a drug abuse treatment and prevention facility.

name: In correctional facility
text: Administer to persons who are in a correctional facility.

name: Persons at risk during an outbreak
text: Administer to persons identified as at increased risk during a community outbreak attributable to a vaccine serogroup.

name: Household contact with hepatitis B surface antigen-positive persons
text: Administer to persons who have household contact with hepatitis B surface antigen-positive persons.

name: Intimate exposure to a documented S. typhi carrier
text: Administer to persons who have intimate exposure to a documented S. typhi carrier.

name: Household and close contacts of immunocompromised persons
text: Administer to persons who are household and close contacts of immunocompromised persons.

name: Negative serological screening for varicella
text: Administer to persons who are serologically negative for varicella.

name: Transgender person
text: Administer to transgender persons.

name: Progressive neurologic disorder
text:
Do not vaccinate if the patient has progressive neurologic disorder until a treatment regimen has been
				established and the condition has stabilized.

name: Received inactivated or unknown measles vaccine between 1963-1967
text: Administer to persons who received inactivated or unknown measles vaccine between 1963-1967.

name: Received killed or unknown Mumps vaccine before 1979
text: Administer to persons who received killed or unknown Mumps vaccine before 1979.

name: Encephalopathy not attributable to another identifiable cause within 7 days of administration of a previous dose of Tdap, DTP, or DTaP vaccine
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had encephalopathy not attributable to another identifiable cause within 7 days of administration of a previous dose of Tdap, DTP, or DTaP vaccine.

name: Adverse reaction to vaccine component
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Polio
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Polio vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Japanese Encephalitis
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Japanese Encephalitis vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Rotavirus
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Rotavirus vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Typhoid
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Typhoid vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Influenza
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Influenza vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Pertussis
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Pertussis vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Diphtheria
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Diphtheria vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Tetanus
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Tetanus vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Varicella
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Varicella vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of HPV
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of HPV vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Measles
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Measles vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Mumps
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Mumps vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Rubella
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Rubella vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Pneumococcal
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Pneumococcal vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Meningococcal
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Meningococcal vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Hepatitis A
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Hepatitis A vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Hepatitis B
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Hepatitis B vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Hib
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Hib vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Yellow Fever
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Yellow Fever vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of live zoster
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of live zoster vaccine.

name: Allergic reaction to egg protein
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has a history of egg allergy.

name: Severe allergic reaction to gelatin
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to gelatin.

name: Severe allergic reaction to arginine
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to arginine.

name: Allergic reaction to latex
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has an allergy to latex.

name: Severe allergic reaction to chicken protein
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to chicken protein.

name: Severe allergic reaction to gentamicin
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to gentamicin.

name: Severe allergic reaction to neomycin
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to neomycin.

name: Severe allergic reaction to streptomycin
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to streptomycin.

name: Severe allergic reaction to polymyxin B
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to polymyxin B.

name: Hypersensitivity to yeast
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has a hypersensitivity to yeast.

name: Hypersensitivity to the preservative 2-phenoxyethanol
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has a hypersensitivity to the preservative 2-phenoxyethanol.

name: Hypersensitivity to alum
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has a hypersensitivity to alum.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Rabies
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Rabies vaccine.

name: End stage renal disease
text: Administer to persons who have end stage renal disease.

name: Severe allergic reaction to protamine sulfate
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to protamine sulfate.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Meningococcal B
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Meningococcal B vaccine.

name: Severe allergic reaction to diphtheria toxoid
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to diphtheria toxoid.

name: Severe allergic reaction to tetanus toxoid
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to tetanus toxoid.

name: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of cholera
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of cholera vaccine.

name: Homelessness
text: Administer to persons who are experiencing homelessness.

name: Tetanus IG administration
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Tetanus IG administered in the previous 3 months.

name: Hep A IG administration
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Hepatitis A IG administered in the previous 3 months.

name: Hep B IG administration
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Hepatitis B IG administered in the previous 3 months.

name: Rabies IG administration
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Rabies IG administered in the previous 4 months.

name: Varicella IG administration
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Varicella IG administered in the previous 5 months.

name: Measles prophylaxis IG administration - Standard
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Measles IG at a standard dose [0.25 mL/kg] administered in the previous 5 months.

name: Measles prophylaxis IG administration - Immunocompromised Contact
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had Measles IG at an immunocompromised dose [0.5 mL/kg] administered in the previous 6 months.

name: RBC [adenine-saline added] blood transfusion
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received a blood transfusion of adenine-saline added RBCs in the previous 3 months.

name: Packed RBC blood transfusion
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received a blood transfusion of packed RBCs in the previous 6 months.

name: Whole blood transfusion
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received a whole blood transfusion in the previous 6 months.

name: Plasma/platelet products blood transfusion
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received a blood transfusion of plasma or platelet product in the previous 7 months.

name: Cytomegalovirus IGIV
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received Cytomegalovirus IGIV in the previous 6 months.

name: IGIV - Replacement therapy for immune deficiencies
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received IGIV [Replacement therapy for immune deficiencies] in the previous 8 months.

name: IGIV - Immune thrombocytopenic purpura treatment
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received IGIV [Immune thrombocytopenic purpura treatment [400 mg/kg IV]] in the previous 8 months.

name: IGIV - Postexposure varicella prophylaxis
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received IGIV [Postexposure varicella prophylaxis] in the previous 8 months.

name: IGIV - Immune thrombocytopenic purpura treatment
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received IGIV [Immune thrombocytopenic purpura treatment [1000 mg/kg IV]] in the previous 10 months.

name: IGIV - Kawasaki disease
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has received IGIV [Kawasaki disease] in the previous 11 months.

name: Travel to or working in countries that have high or intermediate endemicity of Hepatitis A
text: Administer to persons traveling to or working in countries that have high or intermediate endemicity of Hepatitis A.

name: Travel to areas or countries where polio is epidemic or endemic
text: Administer to travelers to areas or countries where polio is epidemic or endemic.

name: International travel with possible contact with animals in areas where rabies is enzootic and immediate access to appropriate medical care might be limited
text: Administer to persons with plans for international travel with possible contact with animals in areas where rabies is enzootic and immediate access to appropriate medical care might be limited.

name: B-lymphocyte [humoral] - Severe antibody deficiencies
text: Administer to persons who have severe B-lymphocyte [humoral] - antibody deficiencies [e.g., X-linked agammaglobulinemia and common variable immunodeficiency]. Do not vaccinate if the patient has severe B-lymphocyte [humoral] - antibody deficiencies [e.g., X-linked agammaglobulinemia and common variable immunodeficiency].

name: B-lymphocyte [humoral] - Less severe antibody deficiencies
text: Administer to persons who have less severe B-lymphocyte [humoral] - antibody deficiencies [e.g., selective IgA deficiency and IgG subclass deficiency]. Do not vaccinate if the patient has less severe B-lymphocyte [humoral] - antibody deficiencies [e.g., selective IgA deficiency and IgG subclass deficiency].

name: T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - Complete defects
text: Administer to persons who have complete cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects [e.g., severe combined immunodeficiency [SCID] disease, complete DiGeorge syndrome]. Do not vaccinate if the patient has complete cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects [e.g., severe combined immunodeficiency [SCID] disease, complete DiGeorge syndrome].

name: T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - Partial defects
text: Administer to persons who have partial cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects [e.g., most patients with DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, ataxia- telangiectasia]. Do not vaccinate if the patient has partial cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects [e.g., most patients with DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, ataxia- telangiectasia].

name: T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - interferon-gamma/Interleukin 12 axis deficiencies
text: Administer to persons who have T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - interferon-gamma or interferon-alpha. Do not vaccinate with live attenuated typhoid virus [Ty21a] if the patient has T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - interferon-gamma/Interleukin 12 axis deficiencies.

name: T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - interferon-gamma or interferon-alpha
text: Administer to persons who have T-lymphocyte [cell-mediated and humoral] - interferon-gamma or interferon-alpha. Do not vaccinate if the patient has cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects related to interferon-gamma or interferon-alpha

name: Persistent complement, properdin, or factor B deficiency
text: Administer to persons who have persistent complement component deficiencies, including inherited or chronic deficiencies in C3, C5-9, properdin, factor D, factor H, or who are taking eculizumab [Soliris].

name: Phagocytic function - Chronic granulomatous disease
text: Administer to persons who have chronic granulomatous disease. Do not vaccinate if the patient has phagocytic function - chronic granulomatous disease.

name: Phagocytic function - Leukocyte adhesion defect, and myeloperoxidase deficiency
text: Administer to persons who have a phagocytic function defect [e.g. leukocyte adhesion defect and myeloperoxidase deficiency]. Do not vaccinate if the patient has a phagocytic function defect [e.g. leukocyte adhesion defect and myeloperoxidase deficiency].

name: HIV/AIDS - severely immunocompromised
text: Administer to persons who have HIV/AIDS and are severely immunocompromised [See the CDC general recommendations for a definition of "severely immunocompromised"]. Do not vaccinate if the patient has HIV/AIDS and is severely immunocompromised [See the CDC general recommendations for a definition of "severely immunocompromised"].

name: HIV/AIDS - not severely immunocompromised
text: Administer to persons who have HIV/AIDS and are not severely immunocompromised [See the CDC general recommendations for a definition of "severely immunocompromised"].

name: Generalized malignant neoplasm
text: Administer to persons who have generalized malignant neoplasm. Do not vaccinate if the patient has generalized malignant neoplasm.

name: Transplantation
text: Administer to persons who have received a transplant. Do not vaccinate if the patient received a transplant.

name: Immunosuppressive therapy
text: Administer to persons who are undergoing immunosuppressive therapy. Immunosuppressive medications include those given to prevent solid organ transplant rejection, human immune mediators like interleukins and colony-stimulating factors, immune modulators like levamisol and BCG bladder-tumor therapy, and medicines like tumor necrosis factor alpha inhibitors and anti-B cell antibodies.  Do not vaccinate if the patient is undergoing immunosuppressive therapy. Immunosuppressive medications include those given to prevent solid organ transplant rejection, human immune mediators like interleukins and colony-stimulating factors, immune modulators like levamisol and BCG bladder-tumor therapy, and medicines like tumor necrosis factor alpha inhibitors and anti-B cell antibodies.

name: Radiation therapy
text: Administer to persons who are undergoing radiation therapy. Do not vaccinate if the patient is undergoing radiation therapy.

name: Anatomical or functional asplenia
text: Administer to persons with anatomic or functional asplenia, including sickle cell disease. Do not vaccinate if the patient has anatomical or functional asplenia.

name: Chronic renal disease
text: Administer to persons with chronic renal disease. Do not vaccinate if the patient has chronic renal disease.

name: Travel to areas at risk for Yellow Fever transmission
text: Administer to persons who travel to areas at risk for Yellow Fever transmission.

name: Travel to areas in which there is a recognized risk of exposure to S. typhi
text: Administer to persons who travel to areas in which there is a recognized risk of exposure to S. typhi.

name: Travel to or are residents of countries in which meningococcal disease is hyperendemic or epidemic
text: Administer to persons who travel to or are residents of countries in which meningococcal disease is hyperendemic or epidemic.

name: Longer-term (e.g., 1 month or more) travel to a JE-endemic area
text: Administer to persons who plan for longer-term (e.g., 1 month or more) travel to JE-endemic areas.

name: Travel to countries with high or intermediate prevalence of chronic HBV infection
text: Administered to persons who travel to countries with high or intermediate prevalence of chronic HBV infection.

name: Nephrotic Syndrome
text: Administer to persons with nephrotic syndrome.

name: Chemotherapy
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient is undergoing chemotherapy, including 14 days before the start of therapy and 3 months after the completion of therapy.

name: History of sexual abuse or assault
text: Administer to persons who have a history of sexual abuse or assault.

name: Date of hematopoietic stem cell transplant
Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of recombinant zoster
text: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of recombinant zoster vaccine.

name: Moving to JE-endemic country to take up residence
text: Administer to persons who plan to move to JE-endemic countries to take up residence.

name: Frequent travel to JE-endemic areas
text: Administer to persons who frequently travel to JE-endemic areas.

name: Patient seeks Hepatitis A protection
text: Administer to persons seeking protection from Hepatitis A.

name: Patient seeks Hepatitis B protection
text: Administer to persons seeking protection from Hepatitis B.

name: Patient seeks Meningococcal B protection
text: Administer to persons seeking protection from Meningococcal B.

name: Leukemia
text: Administer to persons with leukemia.

name: Lymphoma
text: Administer to persons with lymphoma.

name: Hodgkin's disease
text: Administer to persons with Hodgkin's disease.

name: Multiple myeloma
text: Administer to persons with multiple myeloma.
